author: Staff Reporter
text:
Expressing disappointment over the State Government’s announcement in the Assembly that constitution of an expert committee to study their demands is mere ‘eyewash’, government employees continued their protest by cooking food in the District Panchayat Office building premises near Collectorate on Friday.

Their indefinite strike that began on February 10 affected the functioning of the government departments as villagers from long distances who came to the Collectorate for various issues have to return without completing their work. After intensifying their protest last week by blocking the roads, over 500 employees stayed on the premises on Thursday night. On Friday, they cooked food and eat it on the premises. They expressed anger and disappointment over the formation of expert committee and said that their protest would be intensified in the coming days if their demands are not met.
title: Government employees’ indefinite strike continues
